actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Agriculture.

official_title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to make loans to establish and operate agricultural communities that provide shelter and employment for individuals in lieu of certain Federal assistance.

summary.text: Model Farm Village Act of 1983 - Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Farmers Home Administration, to make loans (30-year $7,000,000 maximum) to specified nonprofit organizations to establish and operate rural residential agricultural communities. Sets forth eligibility requirements. Prohibits residents of such communities from receiving Federal benefits under the Food Stamp Act of 1977, the Social Security Act or the Federal Mine Safety and Health Act of 1977. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to make loans to establish and operate agricultural communities that provide shelter and employment for individuals in lieu of certain Federal assistance.
